trustfund: TF037255-VENEZUELA - SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF037253-VENEZUELA - SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Development Project's
            overall borrower performance was unsatisfactory. The project
            experienced some problems which suggest several features of
            project design, institutional context, and implementation
            arrangements that could improve the probability of a
            successful project outcome: 1) a simple project design and
            organization; 2) policies, rules and regulations, practices,
            and definition of institutional roles worked out and agreed
            in detail prior to Board approval; 3) agreement at the
            country level, prior to project preparation, on the general
            terms and conditions for project implementation; 4)
            agreement with the Government on overall priorities and
            funding levels for priority programs and services in the
            relevant sectors; 5) appointment of experienced,
            appropriately project management and staff, with the proper
            incentive structure; 6) Sufficient and accessible project
            funding and adequate provision for financial management and
            accounting; 7) maximum involvement of the communities and
            local governments in all stages of the project cycle; and 8)
            close monitoring by the Bank, with adequate participation by
            appropriate subject matter specialists. Positive social
            investment funds experience in worldwide suggests that a
            semi-autonomous well-managed social fund may offer an
            appropriate vehicle for channeling funds to investments in
            several social sectors.
